pages.text: I have many regrets in my life, but my most recent one is saving a group of kids from some bandits. I don't regret saving them, I just regret doing it in these stupid green clothes. I think they thought I was a superhero or something crazy like that. I saw them being robbed and beaten up so I can over and thorned the bandits until they

ran away. The kids looked at me with a slight look of fear, but also a look of aw out of amazement. They cheered me on and called me Cactus Man. I left before they could get a good look at my face. I didn't want any of them getting in trouble for seeing me. I know that those bandits from a few months back are still looking for me. That's just one more reason to keep trekking on through this dry land. I need

to get back home. I need to find my wife and kids before they do. I don't want to think about what they would do to them to hurt me. Horrible things, I'm sure. Worse than anything they could have done to me. I figured if I'm going to be helping people on my travels I might as well try and find a better way of concealing my identity, but a mask seems really overdone. Maybe a nice pair of

sunglasses. Multipurpose, shade my eyes from the blinding sun, and hide my face. I just don't know where I'm going to be able to get some considering I'm broke and currently nowhere close to any known villages. I suppose that will be my next journey, to find some stupid sunglasses.
